newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine extends privatisation voucher deadline.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine extends privatisation voucher deadline.

text.p: Ukraine has extended the deadline for investment of privatisation certificates to the end of 1997, but the deadline for claiming them is still December 31 this year, the State Property Fund (FDM) chairman said on Monday.

"Parliament, in implementing changes last week to the country's law on privatisation, plans only to extend the deadline for investing the certificates to the end of 1997," Yuri Yekhanurov, head of the state privatisation agency, said.
Parliament decided to maintain the December 31 deadline for citizens to pick up their certificates, which was extended three times this year.
Each Ukrainian is entitled to a privatisation certificate, worth about $275 each, to invest in an enterprise undergoing privatisation.
About 82 percent of the population has claimed the certificates, but only 40 percent of certificates have been invested. The original investment deadline was mid-1997.
The certificate programme represents the government's attempt to involve all citizens in the privatisation process.
However, many cash-strapped Ukrainians are selling their certificates for $7 to $9 each to investment companies.
